page.title: 05LITTLE WITLEY LIFE - COUNCIL
page.content: The present{Parish Council}was formed in 1972. Elections of seven councillors are organized by Malvern District Council every 4 years. {Meetings}are held every three months with occasional extra meetings about planning applications. A chairman and vice-chairman are {elected}annually at the A.G.M. Each councillor also has a particular area of responsibility as regards parish life and welfare. A salaried clerk is appointed on a permanent basis to minute meetings, do correspondence and act as treasurer. The accounts are audited externally every three years. {Contact is made}with neighbouring parish councils. The County Council and District Council also keep the Parish Council informed about relevant matters. The County Association of Local Councils is also helpful.
